Mauritania’s Sidi Ould Tah Elected AfDB President

Mauritania’s Sidi Ould Tah Elected AfDB President On May 29 2025 573 Addis Ababa May 29 2025 (FMC) — Sidi Ould Tah of Mauritania has been elected President of the African Development Bank Group (AfDB) during its Annual Meetings in Abidjan Côte d’Ivoire. Tah who secured the required majority from regional and non-regional members brings over 35 years of experience. As head of the Arab Bank for Economic Development in Africa (BADEA) from 2015 to 2025 he expanded the bank’s balance sheet fourfold secured a AAA rating and built key partnerships. AfDB Board Chair Niale Kaba called the election “a turning point” for African development finance. A former Mauritanian finance minister Tah has led major financial reforms including a $1 billion capital program for African lenders. He succeeds Dr. Akinwumi Adesina of Nigeria. 573
